Then Judas and his brothers began to be feared, and dread fell upon the Gentiles about them.
There appeared to them a richly caparisoned horse, mounted by a fearsome rider. Charging furiously, the horse attacked Heliodorus with its front hooves. The rider was seen wearing golden armor.
For what I feared overtakes me; what I dreaded comes upon me.
Do not be afraid of sudden terror, of the ruin of the wicked when it comes;
Your men will fall by the sword, and your champions, in war;

Let us lie down in our shame, let our disgrace cover us, for we have sinned against the LORD, our God, We and our ancestors, from our youth to this day; we did not listen to the voice of the LORD, our God.”
The LORD is good to those who trust in him, to the one that seeks him;
